reviews.review_msg: He is a nice guy but very disorganized and his canvas is a mess. It's difficult to follow the course content for that reason. Also, assignments are weighted super unevenly making it more difficult to do well.

Love Dr. Yang. He's an amazing professor who's very passionate about his teaching and caring for his students. I agree that his English can be a bit hard to follow from time to time; however, his feedback and accessibility after class totally made up for it. World class aDNA analyst who's extremely respectful to his fellow students. Two thumbs up!

Passionate about his work. His English is a bit hard to follow when he was trying to explain biological terms. However, he cares about his students and always willing to take extra time answering questions and concerns. I would take him again!

Very difficult to understand and not very clear in direction. He is very passionate and excited about what he teaches, unfortunately this doesn't make up for the misunderstandings and miscommunications. Go to him if you have questions he is always willing to help and truly cares about his students.
Very passionate about what he teaches - little hard to understand at times.  Final was pretty straight forward, study the lecture material and you'll do fine.

Great class--definitely recommend to others.  Cons: no textbook (MUST attend class to understand the info); group project worth 60% of grade.  BUT great material, ability to work on original research, rather easy midterm (40% of grade), and prof is v. approachable, helpful, and understanding.
